title: Monetary Policy and Risk Management at a Time of Low Inflation and Low Unemployment
content: 1994 1998 2002 2006 2010 2014 2018  0  10  20  30  40  PercentMonthly Jobs Hard to Fill  1994 1998 2002 2006 2010 2014 2018  0  5  10  15  20  25  30  35  40  PercentMonthly  Poor sales Quality of labor  Most Important Problem      Figure 8.  Indicators of Labor Market Tightness                 Note:  "Jobs hard to fill" series is the share of firms reporting that they have at least one hard−to−fill job opening. "Most important problem" series           is responses to the question "What do you view as your single most important problem?"  All data are monthly and extend through August 2018.                Source:  National Federation of Independent Business Small Business Economic Trends.
